Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview =================
McDonald Observatory Faint Comet Survey Gas Data
This study presents spectral data from 152 observations of 17 comets obtained using an Intensified Dissector Scanner spectrograph at the McDonald Observatory.
A full description of these data and the reduction process, along with Haser model production rates can be found in Cochran et al. (1992) [COCHRANETAL1992].
Parameters ========== All essential parameters including fluxes, aperture positions and size, comet heliocentric and geocentric positions and heliocentric radial velocity are provided in this PDS submission. The fluorescence efficiencies used for the column density calculations can be found in Cochran et al. (1992) [COCHRANETAL1992], along with additional Haser Model parameters and estimated production rates. Measures of the cometary continuum and gas-to-dust ratios are available in Storrs et al. (1992) [STORRSETAL1992].
Processing ========== The processing carried out on the McDonald Observatory Faint Comet Survey are described elsewhere [COCHRANETAL1992; STORRSETAL1992; COCHRAN1987].
Using standard star measurements, the raw data counts were converted to flux units. The separate sky spectrum was then subtracted from the object spectra, weighting by the strength of the 5577 A night sky line to account for different exposure times. A color corrected solar spectrum was then removed and the various bands were integrated in order to measure the emission band intensities. The fluorescence efficiencies given below [COCHRANETAL1992] were then used to convert to column densities.
Molecule Constant CN f(dR/dt) heliocentric C3 12.42 CH 12.98 C2 (delta NU = 1) 12.62 C2 (delta NU = 0) 12.35 NH2 (0,10,0) 13.73
Data ====
1) fluxcdmc.tab: cometocentric aperture positions and fluxes and column densities for all dates. 3) parammc.tab: Contains the parameters associated with the observations.
In calculating the flux and column densities for the six molecular species the following bandpasses (from Table I of COCHRANETAL1992) were used:
molecule Bandpass (A) CN (delta NU = 0) 3830-3905 C3 3975-4150 CH 4280-4340 C2 (delta NU = 1) 4460-4770 C2 (delta NU = 0) 4860-5185 NH2 (0,10,0) 5675-5760
Coverage ========
The following 17 comets are included in this data set:
Principal Obsolete Number, Type and Name Designation Designation(s) ------------------------------ ----------- -------------- 49P/Arend-Rigaux 1951 C2 1984k C/Austin 1982 M1 1982g C/Austin 1984 N1 1984i C/Bradfield 1987 P1 1987s 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko 1969 R1 1982f 26P/Grigg-Skjellerup 1922 K1 1982a, 1986m 68P/Klemola 1965 U1 1987i 22P/Kopff 1906 Q1 1982k, 1988k C/Levy-Rudenko 1984 V1 1984t 25P/Neujmin 1 1913 R2 1984c C/Nishikawa-Takamizawa-Tago 1987 B1 1987c 24P/Schaumasse 1911 X1 1984m C/Sorrells 1986 V1 1986n 64P/Swift-Gehrels 1889 W1 1981j 9P/Tempel 1 1867 G1 1982j 10P/Tempel 2 1873 N1 1982d 1987g 62P/Tsuchinshan 1 1965 A1 1984p
The obsolete designations have been removed from the data files and replaced with the IAU principal designations.
Ancillary Data ============== A complementary dataset regarding the continuum spectral measurements and an ad hoc measure of the cometary dust emission, A(theta)*f*rho [AHEARNETAL1984], can be found in STORRSETAL1992.
Media/Format ============ This dataset is released in the form of ASCII files which may be stored on disk or other magnetic medium and which may be distributed by ftp, email, real-time access by remote login, or by whatever means is most convenient.
